summary: The Second Chance Reauthorization Act of 2025 aims to reauthorize and update the Second Chance Act of 2007. The bill focuses on improving existing programs related to reentry, including expansion of services to address substance use disorders and reentry housing. It amends various sections of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 and the Second Chance Act of 2007, primarily updating funding authorization periods to cover 2026-2030 for several grant programs focused on state and local reentry projects, family-based substance abuse treatment, educational methods in correctional facilities, career training, offender reentry collaboration, and community-based mentoring.
